citation.article-title: A new species of Planococcus, P. kocurii isolated from fish, frozen foods, and fish curing brine.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Planococcus kocurii sp. nov.
Planococcus kocurii (ko.cu'ri.i M.L. gen. n. kocurii of Kocur; named for Miloslav Kocur, Czechoslovakian bacteriologist who revived the genus Planococcus.)
Cells are spherical, 1.0 to 1.2 μm in diameter, occurring singly, in pairs, tetrads and in clumps.
Motile.
The motile cells usually have one or two flagella.
Not spore-forming.
Gram positive.
Colonies on peptone yeast extract agar (PY) plate are circular, convex, smooth, and yellow orange pigmented.
Chemoorganotrophic.
Metabolism respiratory.
Strictly aerobic.
Catalase and DNase are positive.

The following tests are negative: Oxidase, methyl red test, Voges-Proskauer reaction, indole production, hydrogen sulfide, nitrate reduction, phenylalanine deaminase, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases, arginine dihydrolase, hydrolysis of gelatin, Tween-80, and esculin, tyrosine clearing, hydrolysis of starch, and urease.

Acid but no gas is produced aerobically from D-glucose and glycerol in MOF medium of LEIFSON, but not from D-xylose, L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-mannose, sucrose, lactose, D-cellobiose, melibiose, maltose, trehalose, raffinose, starch, erythritol, adonitol, i-inositol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, dulcitol and salicin.

Acetate, glyoxylate, glycolate, pyruvate, n-butyrate, fumarate, succinate, glutarate and hippurate are assimilated, but formate, propionate, oxalate, DL-lactate, malonate, L-malate, α-ketoglutarate, adipate, pimelate, urate, citrate and gluconate are not.
Optimum salinity for growth : 0 to 10% sodium chloride.
No growth at 15%.
Optimum temperature for growth: 25 to 30°C.
Peptidoglycan in the cell wall: L-Lys-D-Glu type.
The DNA base composition is 40.0 mol % guanine plus cytosine.
The menaquinones are MK-7 and MK-8 as major components, and MK-6 as a minor component.
The major cellular fatty acid is anteiso C15:0.
Isolated from skin of North Sea cod, Gadus callarias.
The type strain is HK 701 (=AJ 3345=CCM 1849=IAM 12847=JCM 2569=NCMB 629).
This strain was isolated from the skin of the North Sea cod by Georgala in 1957 (41).
The description is based on the characteristics of the type strain, and variations within the species are shown in Tables 2 through 5, and in Fig. 2.
Strains HK 701, 702, 703, 704, and 705 were studied.
